HIV.D.TB-HIVTODO: description goes hereQuestionnairehttp://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/Questionnaire/HIV.D.TB-HIV#0.3.0
1Whether the client has active TB0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de711#Observation.value[x]
2Active status as defined for reporting indicators0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de712#Observation.value[x]
3Whether a person has had treatment for tuberculosis (TB) and was declared cured or completed treatment0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de715#Observation.value[x]
4The date when the client was diagnosed with tuberculosis (TB)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de720#Observation.value[x]
5Client should be tested for a latent tuberculosis (TB) infection (LTBI)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de721#Observation.value[x]
6Client is currently taking TPT0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de722#Observation.value[x]
7The date on which the client began taking TPT0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de723#Observation.value[x]
8The date the client stopped taking TPT (before completing the treatment)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de724#Observation.value[x]
9The client successfully completed TPT0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de725#Observation.value[x]
10The date on which the client completed TPT0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de726#Observation.value[x]
11Client has previously been treated for tuberculosis (TB)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de727#Observation.value[x]
12Client shares is a household contact of a person with bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary tuberculosis (TB). A household contact person who shared the same enclosed living space as the index case for one or more nights or for frequent or extended daytime periods during the 3 months before the start of current treatment.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de728#Observation.value[x]
13The type of screening for active tuberculosis (TB) that was performed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de729#Observation.value[x]
14A screening for tuberculosis (TB) was performed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de735#Observation.value[x]
15Symptoms that may indicate active TB in clients living with HIV, based on a clinical algorithm0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de736#Observation.value[x]
16Client does not report or exhibit active symptoms of TB0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de745#Observation.value[x]
17Client had a history of a contact with a person with TB0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de746#Observation.value[x]
18A state of persistent immune response to stimulation by M. tuberculosis antigens with no evidence of clinically manifest active tuberculosis (TB). This is also at times referred to as tuberculosis (TB) infection. There is no gold standard test for direct identification of M. tuberculosis infection in humans. Most infected people have no signs or symptoms of tuberculosis (TB) but are at risk for active tuberculosis (TB) disease.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de748#Observation.value[x]
19Record the result of the tuberculosis (TB) screening0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de750#Observation.value[x]
20Date the tuberculosis test was conducted0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de755#Observation.value[x]
21The type of diagnostic test performed to detect active tuberculosis (TB)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de757#Observation.value[x]
22Client is currently being treated for tuberculosis (TB)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de767#Observation.value[x]
23The date on which the client start or restarted tuberculosis (TB) treatment0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de769#Observation.value[x]
24The date the client stopped tuberculosis (TB) treatment (before completing the treatment)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de771#Observation.value[x]
25The client successfully completed tuberculosis (TB) treatment0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de773#Observation.value[x]
26The date on which the client completed tuberculosis (TB) treatment0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de775#Observation.value[x]
27The facility where the client is receiving tuberculosis (TB) treatment0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de777#Observation.value[x]
28TB drugs currently being taken by the client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de779#Observation.value[x]
29Client is eligible for tuberculosis preventive treatment (TPT)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de793#Observation.value[x]
30Date when a determination of the client's eligibility for TPT was made0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de795#Observation.value[x]
31Client's tuberculosis (TB) status when antiretroviral therapy (ART) is started0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de797#Observation.value[x]
32Treatment offered to individuals who are considered at risk of tuberculosis (TB) disease in order to reduce that risk. Also referred to as treatment of tuberculosis (TB) infection, LTBI treatment or tuberculosis (TB) preventive therapy.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de805#Observation.value[x]
33Infant has been exposed to tuberculosis (TB)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de807#Observation.value[x]
34TB status as defined for reporting indicators0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de809#Observation.value[x]
35TB meningitis0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de817#Observation.value[x]
36The date on which the client has a test for C reactive protein0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de819#Observation.value[x]
37Test result of the client's C reactive protein test0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de821#Observation.value[x]
38Date of diagnosis of active TB0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-d-de822#Observation.value[x]

Client shares is a household contact of a person with bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary tuberculosis (TB). A household contact person who shared the same enclosed living space as the index case for one or more nights or for frequent or extended daytime periods during the 3 months before the start of current treatment.
The type of screening for active tuberculosis (TB) that was performed

A state of persistent immune response to stimulation by M. tuberculosis antigens with no evidence of clinically manifest active tuberculosis (TB). This is also at times referred to as tuberculosis (TB) infection. There is no gold standard test for direct identification of M. tuberculosis infection in humans. Most infected people have no signs or symptoms of tuberculosis (TB) but are at risk for active tuberculosis (TB) disease.

Client's tuberculosis (TB) status when antiretroviral therapy (ART) is started

Treatment offered to individuals who are considered at risk of tuberculosis (TB) disease in order to reduce that risk. Also referred to as treatment of tuberculosis (TB) infection, LTBI treatment or tuberculosis (TB) preventive therapy.

TB status as defined for reporting indicators
